definition: cell phone (bulky, early-model one)/brick phone/mob boss
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Cell phones play an important role in our modern world.
sentences.chinese: 大哥大在現代世界扮演一個重要角色。

sentences.english: I need to recharge my cell phone.
sentences.chinese: 我需要充電我的大哥大。

sentences.english: I tried to call your mobile phone, but it was busy.
sentences.chinese: 我有試着打你的大哥大，但忙線中。

sentences.english: Analog cellular phone has been guite popular in our country for many years.
sentences.chinese: 模擬移動電話“大哥大”在我國已風行多年。

sentences.english: My elder sister is three years older than your eldest brother.
sentences.chinese: 我姊姊比你的大哥大三歲。

definition: Personal Handy-phone System (PHS), mobile network system operating in China 1998-2013, branded "Little Smart"
old age/very/eldest child in a family/leader of a group/boss/captain of a boat/leader of a criminal gang
eldest brother/big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself)/gang leader/boss
household with savings or annual income of 10,000 yuan or more (considered a large amount in the 1970s, when the term became established)
bar phone (cell phone shaped like a bar of candy)
